Understate: The claim understates the amount of new lanes that will be added to congested roadways with the proposed $400 million spending.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that none of the $400 million will be used to add new lanes to congested roadways, which is contradicted by the city and Texas Department of Transportation officials who state that about 15 miles of new or extended lanes will be added.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to back up the assertion that no new lanes will be added to congested roadways, as the city and Texas Department of Transportation officials provide evidence to the contrary.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the alternative explanation provided by the city and Texas Department of Transportation officials that some of the spending will go towards projects related to easing access to and from congested roadways.
